content: "Il barbiere di Siviglia" - Libretto Overview (Condensed to 650 Characters)Act 1: The young count Almaviva is in love with Rosina, the ward of the old doctor Bartolo, who plans to marry her himself. Disguised as a poor student named Lindoro, Almaviva seeks to win her heart with the help of the clever barber Figaro.Act 2: Figaro aids Almaviva in gaining access to Rosina, despite Bartolo’s attempts to keep them apart. Disguises, letters, and trickery unfold, with Almaviva nearly caught several times.Act 3: With Figaro’s help, Almaviva and Rosina outwit Bartolo, and the opera concludes with their marriage and triumph over the jealous doctor.
